document_data.mainbody:
Arim Montgar was a horse trader and owner of Montgars Horse Outlet in the Port District in the city of Procampur in the late 14 century DR.
He was the eldest son of Quen Montgar, who owned Montgars Horses, the parent company.
A young man as of 1370 DR, Arim was charming, persuasive, and amiable to all his potential customers. He was also skilled in negotiations and in making a sale.
